bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 6, 1899

div1.p: Lazear informs Sweitzer that Mabel Lazear has given birth to a son, William Houston Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 6, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Feb. 6, 99.
My dear Mother,
div1.p:
This morning I wrote to Mrs.
Houston an account of the events of last
night. Everything has gone an all right today
Mabel is bright and well and complains only
of hunger. We have been having a great deal
of snow here, and I suppose you have the
same. I hope it will not interfere with
your sight-seeing. The picture you and Mrs Houston
sent is very pretty, I have always liked it
and it is very effective in the drawing room.
Thank you very much for the “Times”.

Your letter came this morning with the check
for which I thank you in the name of
the youngster, but really he has no name
as yet. Mabel slept well last night.
and is all right this morning. I am
glad you are coming on Saturday but it
is just as well to wait until then.
